titleStmt.title: Edgar Keenon to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5665

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Auditor's Office, Kentucky.
WILLIAM T. SAMUELS,
Attorney at Law & General Collecting Agent,
FRANKFORT, KY.
☞ Special attention given to the collection of all claims confided to him throughout the State of Kentucky.

☞ No claim whatever will be paid, unless the person to whom the claim is ordered to be paid by the Court, assigns or indorses it, by writing his name upon the back of said claim, in the same manner as a check or draft, drawn to order, is transferred or assigned.

Frankfort, Ky., July 25 1864.
Hon. Thos E. Bramlette
Govr. Ky.
Sir

Jno. B. Gowen Shff of Christian Co for 1860 -- this day paid balance on Rev. for Said year, with In't. & costs, and now prayes your Excellency to be releived from the payment of Twenty Six hundred thirty eight Dollars 77 cts being the amt. of Damages adjudged agst him for the non payment of the Revenue at the time required by Law

Resply
E J Keenon
Asst. Aud

Franklin Cir Ct
vs
John B Gowen
Shff
Damages
29th AJuly/64
